questions.question: The surfaces that must be cleaned and decontaminated more rigorously than the others are:
The method used to decontaminate a surface in a dental treatment area is:

choices.answer: use of a surface barrier to prevent contamination
precleaning and disinfecting the surface between patients

questions.question: If the surface below the barrier is inadvertently touched when removing a contaminated barrier;

choices.answer: the surface does not have to be cleaned and disinfected
the surface needs to be cleaned and disinfected
the surface should have a double layer over it
the surface should be wiped with alcohol

questions.question: The purpose of precleaning a surface is:

choices.answer: to reduce the number of microbes
to remove accumulated blood, saliva, and other body fluids
None of these are correct, precleaning is not necessary

questions.question: Precleaning can be accomplished using:

choices.answer: a disinfectant that cleans and disinfects

questions.question: Chemicals that destroy most pathogenic microorganisms on inanimate surfaces are called:
Disinfectants used in dentistry must be:

choices.answer: registered with the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA)
registered as hospital disinfectants & tuberculocidal claims

questions.question: Which of the following can be used as a surface disinfectant in the dental office?
For sterilization to occur using glutaraldehyde, items must be immersed for atleast ___ hours
The high-level disinfectant that does not require activation or mixing and has little odor is:
Carpet in dental treatment areas:

choices.answer: is as easy to clean as nonporous hard-surface flooring

questions.question: To avoid contamination in a dental treatment area, the best approach is to:

choices.answer: disinfect the tray, light handles, and patient chair
disinfect the light handle, chair handle, and patient items
disinfect those surfaces touched by dental instruments
assume all surfaces have been contaminated

questions.question: The correct protocol for barrier use include:

choices.answer: removing and discarding with gloved hands
using a barrier resistant to fluids
disinfecting barriers using the spray-wipe-spray technique

questions.question: Acceptable barriers include:
All of the following surfaces should be protected from contamination with barriers except:

choices.answer: head rest and control buttons on the chair
light handles, light switches, and x-ray control switches
light-curing device, drawer, and air-water syringe handles
counter tops in the reception area

questions.question: The agency that regulates and registers disinfectants and chemical sterilants is:
One difference between a disinfectant and sterilant is:

choices.answer: a disinfectant kills pathogens remaining after precleaning
a disinfectant destroys all spores and fungi

questions.question: A product capable of killing spores is:
A product capable of killing a virus should be labeled:
The intermediate level disinfectant that is no longer recommended for use in dentistry is:
